text:
Please try a trivial JSP

<%@page contentType="text/html"%>
<html>
<head><title>JSP Page</title></head>
<body>
test
<% 
pageContext.getResponse().flushBuffer();
%>

</body>
</html>

to see how generated response never terminates and times out. It's not as 
noticable in 4.0.3. However in 4.0 you would get a header of the last chunk of 
HTTP Response at the end of the HTML.

This bug is introduced in 4.0.x for 3.3.x does not have it.
creator: zander@objectstorm.net
remm@apache.org
text:
Obviously, there have been some fixes between 4.0 and 4.0.3, including fixes to 
the HTTP/1.1 compliance. The 4.0 maintanance branch is 4.0.x, so if there is a 
problem, you should upgrade. I'll see with a telnet what it does. I'll also try 
with the new HTTP/1.1 connector.

creator: zander@objectstorm.net
text:
This bug is in 4.0.3 release. It was introduced with 4.0 release. I tested it 
on 4.0 Final, 4.0.3 Final and 3.3.x. Both 4.0.x releases mentioned has the bug. 
3.3.x does not.

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
I can confirm the bug (the HTTP response is invalid) with the HTTP/1.1 
connector. It is extremely likely this won't be fixed, as the old connector is 
very hard to maintain.

Coyote HTTP/1.1 doesn't have the bug, and generates a correct HTTP/1.1 response 
(using chunking).
